text.p: These are the leading stories in the Mozambican press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Dozens of trucks carrying South African produce to Mozambique are being held at the Komatipoort border crossing because of a clampdown by Mozambican customs department on importers who dodge import duties.

- The Mozambican government has received slightly more than a million dollars in aid after an appeal last month for $30 million to help about 400,000 flood victims, Natural Disasters Department chief Silvano Langa said.
